topics.title: Introduction
topics.summary: Statistical simulation refers to the use of random sampling techniques to model and analyze complex systems or stochastic processes. It helps approximate results that are otherwise difficult to compute analytically.

subtopics.title: Example
subtopics.narration: Estimation of π using random points inside a unit square. Steps: (1) Generate N random points (x, y) in [0,1] × [0,1]. (2) Count how many fall inside the unit circle (x² + y² < 1). (3) Estimate π as 4 × (points inside circle) / N.

subtopics.title: Python Example
subtopics.narration: ```python import numpy as np N = 1000000 x = np.random.rand(N) y = np.random.rand(N) pi_est = 4 * np.sum(x**2 + y**2 <= 1) / N print("Estimated π:", pi_est) ``` This code generates one million random points, checks which lie inside the unit circle, and computes an estimate of π.
